Disturbing Visions.name: Disturbing Visions
Disturbing Visions.flavor: Terrible illusions plague your enemiesâ€™ minds, causing them to flee in fright.
Disturbing Visions.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence or Charisma modifier psychic damage, and you slide the target 2 squares. In addition, the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Taunting Decoy.name: Taunting Decoy
Taunting Decoy.flavor: An image of you appears near your enemy, drawing its attacks.
Taunting Decoy.effect: You conjure a decoy of yourself in an unoccupied square within range. The decoy occupies 1 square, and it lasts until the end of your next turn. When you conjure the decoy, it marks one enemy within 5 squares of it until the end of your next turn. The decoy can be attacked, and when the enemy marked by the decoy hits it, the mark ends and the decoy teleports 5 squares. As a move action, you can move the decoy 3 squares.
Taunting Decoy.sustainMinor: The decoy persists, and it marks one enemy within 5 squares of it.

Phantasmist Stalker.name: Phantasmist Stalker
Phantasmist Stalker.flavor: You summon a feral, gangly creature of shadow and mist to do your bidding.
Phantasmist Stalker.effect: You summon a Medium phantasmist stalker in an unoccupied square within range. The stalker has speed 7. It has a +4 bonus to AC and to Reflex and a +5 bonus to saving throws against fear effects and charm effects. Whenever the stalker hits a creature granting combat advantage to it, that creature takes ongoing 5 psychic damage (save ends). You can give the phantasmist stalker the following special commands.
Phantasmist Stalker.minorAction: The phantasmist stalker moves 7 squares. It is insubstantial while moving.
Phantasmist Stalker.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence or Charisma vs. Reflex; 1d8 + Intelligence or Charisma modifier psychic damage.
Phantasmist Stalker.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence or Charisma vs. Reflex; 1d8 + Intelligence or Charisma modifier psychic damage.
